pros: Overall GLBHC offers fair salaries, has a good work environment, and senior management that cares about providing excellent care to patients.
Good pay and benefits, nice staff
cons: Management is a bit biased. Does not give you the proper tools to succeed

pros: The company really cares about you as an employee and making sure you have everything you need to do your job in order to care for patients. The executive team is passionate about their mission and it really trickles down through the rest of the organization. You feel like you're really part of a family working towards a common goal.
cons: The patients are very sick, with poor health literacy. They require a lot of management and education which can take more than the 20 minute allotted for the office visits. Also sometimes it seems like no matter what you do they keep going to the ED, which is unfortunately normal in low income areas. The upside is that you're really making a difference in these patients that need your help.

pros:
Pay
Work and life balance 
Friendly coworker
cons: Upper management do not really care about low level employees

pros: Great coworkers, dedication to patient care and the community
good learning experience, will grow knowledge base
cons: salary, underpaid for all the responsibility / workload

pros: Good experience, great staff and coworkers, patient care
cons: Travel, hours, resources, charting, work life balance

pros: This is a hectic call center with continuous calls. Company is nonprofit and testing people kindly is their philosophy.  That extends to their employees.  4wks vacation, and $13.25 an HR starting pay with full benefits including vision and dental; I especially appreciate my supervisor's style of leadership.  This is a huge improvement over my previous job at Morley.
cons: They don't have 15 min breaks.  But if you need a break you can take it.  Took some getting used to. Lunch is early, 11:30.

review_title: Great opportunity to grow and learn
job_title: Care Management Nurse in Saginaw, MI
pros: I worked at the Ruffin Center in Saginaw. The providers were very caring and always willing to teach and answer questions and the staff was very supportive. I couldn't have asked for a better opportunity as a new nurse. The work was challenging but incredibly rewarding!
cons: Stressful work environment however I believe all nursing positions are as well so this is not really a con.

pros: A lot of people who believe in helping others, a fun atmosphere.  The constant challenges and ongoing change provides a lot of opportunity to grow and learn new things.
cons: There seems to be a lack of cohesive long-term planning.  The constant rush of activity is almost always reactive, not proactive.  The chaos often devolves into 'riding the avalanche'.

job_title: Behavioral Health Specialist in Saginaw, MI
cons: Run by a board of doctors who lack compassion, empathy, & real-world reasoning skills. COVID-19 response was literally terrible--laid off immediately with no ability to communicate to client. Management was a joke--nurses running behavioral health programs, supervisors with no communication skills, harsh attendance policies, pointless meetings, ethical concerns

pros: Food everyday. Never have to bring a lunch.  A lot of down time.
cons: Standing constantly even when eating. Owners were never there
